messages.content:
I want to help me to make a good outstanding resume, that will pass through any screening process in the UK, 

I will tell you on which company I am about to apply, I will give the job title as well as the job description, and then I will start giving you details about my experience, what did I worked on and what did I learned, and I want you to help me prepare the best resume that dose not sounds like a regular AI generated resume, but as a professional resume that represents me well

Absolutely, I'd be happy to help you craft an outstanding resume for your job application in the UK. Here's how we can proceed:

1. **Company and Job Title**: Please provide the name of the company and the specific job title you're applying for. 

2. **Job Description**: Share the job description. This will help us understand what the employer is looking for and tailor your resume to highlight relevant skills and experiences.

3. **Your Experience**: Detail your work experience, skills, and any relevant projects or accomplishments. Be specific about your roles, responsibilities, and what you've learned in each position.

4. **Education and Certifications**: Include your educational background and any certifications that may be relevant to the job.

5. **Additional Information**: Any other information that could be relevant, such as volunteer work, languages spoken, technical skills, or interests.

6. **Format and Style Preferences**: If you have any preferences regarding the format or style of the resume, please let me know.

Once you provide this information, I will assist you in organizing and phrasing it in a way that is professional, engaging, and tailored to the job you're applying for. Remember, a great resume not only lists your experiences but also demonstrates how they make you a perfect fit for the job you're applying for. Let's get started!

I will start with the job title and description

the job title Software Development Engineer, AWS

the job description:

DESCRIPTION
Would you like to help implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve the most complex technical problems? Are you excited by the prospect of designing, building and evolving the world's largest cloud computing infrastructure to provide a better world for future generations?
Amazon Web Services (AWS) conceives, builds and operates some of the largest internet infrastructure on the planet; providing companies of all sizes with an infrastructure web services platform in the cloud. With AWS, customers provision compute power, storage, database, and other cloud resources as their business demands them. To meet the growing demand for AWS Services around the globe, we need exceptionally motivated people who are driven by learning and innovation.
If you join us, you’ll be part of a world-class team in a dynamic environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain world class experience in cloud computing. You'll be surrounded by people who are passionate about cloud computing, believe that first class service is critical to customer success, and are committed to improvement.
Top reasons to join our team:

§ Be a catalyst to deliver a truly disruptive products that are growing rapidly
§ Define, build, own, and run a service in high growth environment
§ Solve unique and first-order problems in massive-scale areas such as compute services, DynamoDB/NoSQL databases, Glacier and S3 data lakes, and many other AWS Services
§ Learn how to build and operate distributed systems at massive scale
§ Build and influence the tools and utilities that are part of the AWS fleet running our internal services

WHAT DOES A SOFTWARE ENGINEER DO AT AMAZON?

Amazon has a collaborative, purposeful and enthusiastic environment where we “Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History.” On a typical day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues.

A software engineer at Amazon will have technical ownership of designs and services, and will influence good coding practices among peers. Responsibilities will include designing, coding, reviewing, testing, fixing, researching, deploying and maintaining services and code in Amazon cloud production environments. Successful candidates will be experienced software engineers who can prioritize well, are good team players, develop at a high standard, can deal with new and ambiguous problem domains, and have a consistent track record of delivery.

The Role:

At Amazon our software engineers take ownership of solution design, turn it into code and deliver it on schedule, using appropriate technologies and current software engineering best practices. They are expected to collaborate with their team and across teams to take responsibility for improvements and building of new tooling, features, services and applications.

Amazon software engineers have the responsibility of building, maintaining and running the software they own including the dependencies of their team’s software, hardware platform, operating system and build. They may also be part of an on-call rotation within their team and, in the event of problems, are able to troubleshoot, research the root cause and thoroughly resolve defects.


Inclusive Team Culture

Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and we host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.
Work/Life Harmony

Our team also puts a high value on work-life harmony. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success here.

Mentorship & Career Growth

Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. Our senior members enjoy one-on-one mentoring and detailed and constructive code reviews. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded engineer and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.



We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

London, GBR

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
- Experience building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
- Experience contributing to the architecture and design (architecture, design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and current systems
- Experience programming with at least one modern language such as Java, C++, or C# including object-oriented design
- Knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals, including; data structures, object oriented programming, design and analysis of algorithms, with comprehensive problem-solving skills and ability to articulate real world problems and create technical solutions.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
- 3+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
- Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
- Experience developing and operating across full stack production systems; including client facing front end application, backend/middleware and underlying infrastructure (physical and logical).

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

Our inclusive culture empowers Amazonians to deliver the best results for our customers. If you have a disability and need an adjustment during the application and hiring process, including support for the interview or onboarding process, please contact the Applicant-Candidate Accommodation Team (ACAT), Monday through Friday from 7:00 am GMT - 4:00 pm GMT. If calling directly from the United Kingdom, please dial +44 800 086 9884 (tel:+448000869884). If calling from Ireland, please dial +353 1800 851 489 (tel:+3531800851489)

Thank you for providing the job title and detailed description for the Software Development Engineer position at Amazon Web Services (AWS). To tailor your resume effectively for this role, we need to align your experiences and skills with the key requirements and preferences mentioned in the job description.

The next step is to gather information about your professional background. Please provide details on the following:

1. **Professional Experience**: Share your work history, particularly focusing on roles and projects relevant to software development. Mention specific technologies you've worked with, the scale of the projects, and any notable achievements or contributions. 

2. **Education**: Outline your educational background, especially in computer science or related fields. Include any relevant courses or projects that demonstrate your knowledge and skills in areas mentioned in the job description, like Java, C++, C#, data structures, object-oriented programming, etc.

3. **Skills and Certifications**: List any specific skills or certifications that align with the job requirements, such as experience in full software development life cycle, coding standards, and source control management.

4. **Additional Projects or Contributions**: If you have worked on any side projects, open-source contributions, or have any other technical achievements that could demonstrate your passion and ability in software engineering, please include them.

5. **Soft Skills and Personal Traits**: Highlight any aspects of your personality or work style that align with Amazon's culture, such as ability to work in a team, mentorship, commitment to diversity and inclusion, and work-life harmony.

6. **Format Preferences**: If you have any specific preferences for how you'd like your resume to be structured or any particular style elements, let me know.

Once I have this information, I will help you construct a resume that showcases your qualifications in a way that is tailored to this specific role at AWS. Remember, the goal is to make your resume stand out by clearly demonstrating how your skills and experiences make you an ideal candidate for this position.

OK here is my Professional Experience

Re:Coded, Mosul, Iraq 
Training Assistance, Mar 2020 - Sep 2020 5 months
Helping with class preparations, code reviews for student assignments.
Providing office hours for technical questions and  1-1s to mentor students in both technical and non-technical sides.
leading a team with their capstone project by giving them code reviews and applying the agile methodology on the work and more

Bloom, Lebanon, Beirut / UK London
Full Stack Software Engineer, Aug 2020 - Present  ~= 3.5 years
Started as a three months intrentship, but after around a month I became a junior developer
Work on maintaining and developing an old repo that has a react app written using react class component with no typescript support, it started few years before I join and have passed through few developers over the cors of that period, which made it not consistent and hard to deal with, that was my first big challenge, I had to spend a lot of time refactoring the code each time I want to do a small task to prevent bugs
There was few fires that needed to put down when I joined so I had to learn how to do debuggin in an relatively challenging environment so I learned how to be a good debugger.
That was on the Front-end side, the Back-end side, there was a repo with an express app connected to a mongoDB hosted on atlas, so I was maintaining and developing that all along
After few months with the help of some very talented mentors and collages I managed to put together a plan to migrate the old Front-end repo to a new repo that we will start using typescript and modern react, and we will pay a close attention to a good set of coding standrens like DRY, KISS, consistency, good variable naming, design patterns, and everything that would help to keep the code as readable and simple as possible.
We used to follow a feature-branch-based git flow to mange the collaborating over our repos, we paid good attention to how to make good commits, and how to write short but informatice commit message, we want to have a clear and clean git history by following all the advance techniques that git was providing for us
I worked on shipping many many features big and small, with the help of my mentors and collages, following an agile methodolyge and implementing a scrum sprints we managed to transform the Bloom platform to a much better version, some of these features are (ritch-text editor, notifications system, real-time updates, taskboard, comments section, assessments manger, a bunch of dashboards, and much more)
I was also responsible for everything related to devops, we used AWS to deploy or SAAS app, I worked closely with many AWS services like EC2, S3, Cloudformation, Load-balancers, VPCs, Routers, secrets-manger, and much more
After a year or so we integrated discourse into our website, so I worked on hosting discourse using docker and docker-compose on AWS, managing a PostgresQL database for it and SSO login integrated with our platform
I worked on integrating GraphQL with mongodb atlas so we can use GQL queries from our front-end repo
I managed to configure a testing enviroumnt from scratch using cypress, and I made a workflow for it using github actions and AWS ESR to be able to always have an updated image for the Back-end repo to be able to pull it with github actions each time we want to run a test in the CI/CD pipeline
Me amd My collage developed an admin panel from scratch using nextJs and typescript to help Bloom admins mutate some of the platform important stuff, we used next-auth for authentictations, and modern styling libraries like tailwind and chakra-UI, and we are using react-query to mange the web traffic
We now have a library of activities that users with specific roles can add to it or edit the content there, and from that library you can add tasks for your team/s directly
There are more smaller projects that I worked on such-as some integrations with airtable, some discourse add-ons, etc
During my time with Bloom I have made over 2,540 commit, I added over 450,000 lines, and deleted over 433,000

Unboxed, USA
Software Engineer, Sep 2023 - Present  3 months
Software Development solutions company (B2B & C2B)
The company works on building, maintaining, debugging, and developing apps for mobile, web, and different interfaces
Joined the team as a software engineer
First task is working on a react-native mobile app to help users loggin web3 transactions on the Solana network as the time the transaction happen using webhooks from Helius and push notifications
The BE using nextjs serverless functions and postgress as a database, hosted that on vercel because it was cheap
The Front-end was the react-native app and I also build a web-page for it
As I was starting the app I found that I was writing a lot of boiler-plate code to kickstart things, so I decided to develop a template repo to help with boosting up the time needed when we start a new app
The template will have all of our preferred configurations for eslint, prettier, …etc
The template will have samples of code that you can copy-paste them when you want to create a new component, endpoint, file, …etc
One of the main reasons is I have some abstractions in my code on how to use several libraries, like for example react-table or react-querry, where I will have all the wiring in one file and I expose only a simple function/component that need only few things to get everything working smoothly for a better developer experience
Lastly I worked on shopify app, there was an old app with three very outdated repos to run the app, and I worked on revamping the app
Now the app uses the latest Remix shopify app template (this is the recommended template by Shopify) 
On the database side we have Mongodb
A big part of the app is on the DevOps side, the app uses Shopify webhooks to send events to AWS eventbridge, and the last one takes these events and puts them in a number of SQS queues, depending on some logic, after there is a lambda function for each SQS queue to take the messages and do some logic to them
All of that setup is on AWS and it is being managed through Terraform (Infrastructure As Code tool) I put that in the same repo to make it easier to manage
I highly value clean code principles and whenever I build everything I strive to make it as simple as possible so that when a developer comes after me he will have to spend the smallest effort possible to get onboard

Thank you for providing a detailed overview of your professional experience. Based on this information, here's how we can structure your resume to highlight your strengths and align with the Software Development Engineer role at AWS:

### Resume Structure

1. **Contact Information**
   - Your Name
   - Location (City, Country)
   - Email Address
   - LinkedIn Profile / GitHub (if applicable)

2. **Professional Summary**
   - A brief statement summarizing your software engineering expertise, emphasizing your full-stack development skills, experience with AWS, and commitment to writing clean, maintainable code.

3. **Professional Experience**
   - **Bloom, Lebanon, Beirut / UK London**  
     *Full Stack Software Engineer (Aug 2020 - Present)*  
       - Transitioned from intern to junior developer, demonstrating rapid learning and adaptability.
       - Led the refactoring of a legacy React application, implementing TypeScript and modern React practices.
       - Played a key role in backend development using Express and MongoDB, ensuring efficient data handling.
       - Spearheaded the integration of GraphQL, enhancing data querying capabilities.
       - Managed AWS deployment and DevOps, gaining proficiency in EC2, S3, CloudFormation, etc.
       - Developed and maintained a comprehensive testing environment using Cypress and GitHub Actions.
       - Co-created an admin panel with Next.js and TypeScript, focusing on user-friendly design and efficient data management.

   - **Re:Coded, Mosul, Iraq**  
     *Training Assistant (Mar 2020 - Sep 2020)*  
       - Assisted in class preparations and provided mentorship in technical and non-technical areas.
       - Led a student team in their capstone project, applying agile methodologies and providing code reviews.

   - **Unboxed, USA**  
     *Software Engineer (Sep 2023 - Present)*  
       - Developing a React Native mobile app for logging Web3 transactions on the Solana network.
       - Established a template repository to standardize and expedite new app development.
       - Revamped a Shopify app, utilizing modern frameworks and managing AWS infrastructure with Terraform.

4. **Technical Skills**
   - Languages: JavaScript (React, Next.js), TypeScript, GraphQL, etc.
   - Tools & Platforms: AWS (EC2, S3, CloudFormation, etc.), MongoDB, Cypress, GitHub Actions, Docker, Terraform.
   - Methodologies: Agile, Scrum, DevOps, Clean Code Principles.

5. **Education**
   - [Your Degree and University, if applicable]

6. **Certifications**
   - [Any relevant certifications]

7. **Projects**
   - Highlight key projects you worked on, especially those where you had significant impact or learned valuable skills.

8. **Additional Information**
   - Mention any open-source contributions, community involvement, or languages spoken, if relevant.

### Tips for Your Resume

- **Tailor Your Summary**: Emphasize your experience with AWS and full-stack development, aligning with the job description.
- **Quantify Achievements**: Where possible, use numbers to quantify your impact (e.g., "Managed over 450,000 lines of code").
- **Clean and Professional Format**: Choose a clean, professional layout that makes your resume easy to read.
- **Match Job Description Keywords**: Incorporate keywords from the AWS job description to pass automated resume screening systems.
- **Proofread**: Ensure there are no grammatical or spelling errors.

This structure and these tips should help in creating a resume that not only showcases your skills and experiences but also aligns closely with the requirements and culture of AWS. Remember, your resume is your personal marketing document – it should reflect your professional journey and capabilities effectively.

you removed a lot of what I wrote in the experience section, I also had a lot of numbers that you deleted

another thing is you put a lot of "etc" can you replace them with the details needed

Certainly! Let's refine your professional experience section to include more specific details and incorporate the numbers and achievements you mentioned. Here's a revised version:

### Revised Professional Experience Section

1. **Bloom, Lebanon, Beirut / UK London**
   - **Full Stack Software Engineer (Aug 2020 - Present)**  
     - Rapidly progressed from a three-month internship to a junior developer role, demonstrating exceptional adaptability and skill.
     - Led a major initiative to refactor a legacy React application, incorporating TypeScript and modern React practices, significantly enhancing code maintainability and reducing bug incidence.
     - Spearheaded the backend development of an Express application connected to MongoDB, optimizing data handling and application performance.
     - Drove the integration of GraphQL with MongoDB Atlas, enabling efficient data querying from the front end.
     - Managed AWS deployment and DevOps operations, gaining in-depth experience with services including EC2, S3, CloudFormation, Load Balancers, VPCs, and Secrets Manager.
     - Developed and maintained a sophisticated CI/CD pipeline using Cypress for testing, GitHub Actions for automation, and AWS ECR for image management, contributing to streamlined development processes.
     - Co-developed an admin panel using Next.js and TypeScript, implementing authentication with NextAuth and adopting modern UI libraries like Tailwind CSS and Chakra UI.
     - Engaged in the development of numerous features like rich-text editor, notifications system, real-time updates, and taskboards, enhancing the user experience and platform functionality.
     - Contributed over 2,540 commits, adding over 450,000 lines of code and deleting over 433,000 lines, showcasing significant involvement and impact on the project.

2. **Re:Coded, Mosul, Iraq**
   - **Training Assistant (Mar 2020 - Sep 2020)**  
     - Assisted in class preparations and mentored students on both technical and non-technical aspects.
     - Led a team in their capstone project, implementing agile methodologies, conducting code reviews, and ensuring project success.

3. **Unboxed, USA**
   - **Software Engineer (Sep 2023 - Present)**  
     - Working on a React Native mobile app for real-time logging of Web3 transactions on the Solana network using Helius webhooks and push notifications.
     - Involved in full-stack development, including serverless functions in Next.js, PostgreSQL databases, and front-end development for web and mobile platforms.
     - Initiated the creation of a template repository to standardize new app development, incorporating preferred configurations and sample code for rapid project initiation.
     - Overhauled a Shopify app using the latest Remix Shopify app template, managing MongoDB databases and handling Shopify webhooks integration with AWS EventBridge, SQS queues, and Lambda functions via Terraform.

### Refinement Notes

- **Specific Technologies and Tools**: I've included more specific technologies and tools you've worked with, as per your original description.
- **Quantitative Details**: I've retained the numbers you provided, such as the number of commits and lines of code added/deleted, to quantify your contributions.
- **Role Responsibilities and Achievements**: Each role now includes more detailed descriptions of your responsibilities and achievements, reflecting the complexity and scope of your work.

This revised section should provide a more comprehensive and detailed view of your professional experience, aligning closely with the requirements of the AWS Software Development Engineer role. Remember, the key is to showcase not just what you did, but also the impact and value you brought to each role.
